page.title: 17SCHOOLS IN CORSHAM
page.content: After primary school the pupils will then progress to a secondary school, at the age of 11. As the differences between the two schools are huge, it would be an incredibly difficult step up for the child, so in 1975 the primary-secondary-school liaison was brought into the area.The idea was to let fourth year pupils spend a week in the Comprehensive school and get to know what life is like. They would get shown around and told what is what.The pupils would be taught by various teachers so that they would get a taste of the subjects and get to know some of the teachers at the comprehensive school.The pupils are arranged into tutor groups,with a group tutor. The main subjects are Maths,English and P.E.The primary pupils get to do all of these subjects.
